segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment by which the sender uniquely identifies the Utilities time series message by means of its name and number and when necessary its function.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying general dates and, when relevant, times related to the whole message. The segment must be specified at least once to specify the message date as allocated by the sender.

segment.name: Market/sales channel information
segment.documentation: MKS, A segment to specify to which market and/or through which sales distribution channel and/or for which end-use the time series relates.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments giving references and, where necessary, their dates relating to the whole message.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying a reference by its type and number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the referenced information.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information relevant to the whole message.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the message. It is recommended that, if possible, only the coded form of the party ID should be specified.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for inclusion of any references related to the current party, e.g. fiscal number, government reference number, etc.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments giving contact details of a specific person and/or department within the party identified.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person and/or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communication type and number for the contact specified.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments specifying the currencies, related dates/periods and status for the rate of exchange valid for the whole message.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currencies specified in the message, such as the currency in which the prices are expressed. A rate of exchange may be given to convert a reference currency into a target currency.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period related to the rate of exchange.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, A segment giving a status for the range of exchange, such as if the exchange rate is preliminary or accurate.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: SG7-SG8-SG10-SG11-SG12-SG13-SG14 A group of segments providing details of the time series and connected technical and/or administrative information. In addition to the time series itself, this includes identification of the time series, associated dates, references, characteristics, etc.

segment.name: Identity
segment.documentation: IDE, A segment identifying a time series, the type of object and the product or service being reported in the time series (e.g. electrical energy, electrical power, water, gas).

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to identify location(s) related to the time series.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify a premise or a party related to the time series.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that special condition due to the origin, customs preference, fiscal or commercial factors are applicable.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment providing additional identification to the product or service specified.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment to describe the product or service being reported. The segment may be used for specification of the use of the product (e.g. if the product is consumed, produced etc.).

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify dates associated with the time series.

segment.name: Process identification
segment.documentation: PRC, A segment to specify to which business activity phase the time series relates.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, A segment giving the status for the time series being reported, such as metered, estimated or corrected.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments for specifying any references and associated dates valid for the current time series.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying any references related to the current time series.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify any dates associated with the current reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments providing characteristics and characteristic details connected to the current time series.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify characteristic and/or the characteristic name and characteristic relevance for the time series.

segment.name: Characteristic value
segment.documentation: CAV, A segment to specify the value of the characteristic previously defined in either coded form or in free format.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments providing details of time series defining quantities, such as consumption, production, corrected quantities, etc. and associated dates or periods.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the quantity details.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify dates or periods related to the previously specified quantity information.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, A segment giving the status for the quantity, e.g. metered, estimated or corrected.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments providing characteristics and characteristic details connected to the current quantity, such as the number of digits and the constant of a meter.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify characteristic and/or the characteristic name and characteristic relevance for the quantity, such as the number of digits and the constant of a meter.

segment.name: Characteristic value
segment.documentation: CAV, A segment to specify the value of the characteristic previously defined in either coded form or in free format.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments providing details of time series defining rate of exchange and related dates/periods.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currency details and rate of exchange.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period related to the rate of exchange.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, A segment giving the status for the rate of exchange, such as if the exchange rate is preliminary or accurate.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments providing details of time series defining prices and associated dates or periods and currencies.

segment.name: Price details
segment.documentation: PRI, A segment identifying the price details.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currency applicable for the price. A rate of exchange may be given to convert a reference currency into a target currency.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify dates or periods related to the previously specified price information or to the rate of exchange.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, A segment giving the status for the price or the rate of exchange, such as estimated, corrected or preliminary.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments providing details of time series defining monetary amounts and associated dates or periods.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amount.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify dates or periods related to the previously specified monetary amount.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, A segment giving the status for the monetary amount, such as accurate, estimated or corrected.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments providing details of time series defining percentages and associated dates or periods.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment identifying the percentage details.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify dates or periods related to the previously specified percentage information.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, A segment giving the status for the percentage, such as estimated or corrected.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments providing details of time series defining ranges, i.e. maximum and minimum values and associated dates or periods.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment identifying the range details.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify dates or periods related to the previously specified range information.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, A segment giving the status for the range details, such as estimated or corrected.

segment.name: Control total
segment.documentation: CNT, A segment to provide message control totals.
